options.value: Neither conclusion II nor III follows
Either conclusion I or III follows
Both conclusions I and III follow

english.explanation: The statements are: 1. All rugs are blankets. 2. All blankets are pillows. 3. Some blankets are frames. From 1 and 2, we derive 'All rugs are pillows' (transitive property). Conclusion I (All pillows are rugs) is invalid since the converse does not hold. Conclusion II (Some pillows are rugs) is valid because all rugs are a subset of pillows, ensuring overlap. Conclusion III (All rugs are frames) is invalid as the premises only state some blankets are frames, not all. Thus, only conclusion II logically follows.

hindi.correct_answer: 3. केवल निष्कर्ष II अनुसरण करता है
hindi.explanation: कथनों के अनुसार, सभी कालीन कंबल हैं और सभी कंबल तकिए हैं। इसलिए, कुछ तकिए कालीन होने की संभावना है (निष्कर्ष II)। हालांकि, सभी तकिए कालीन नहीं हो सकते (निष्कर्ष I गलत) और सभी कालीन फ्रेम भी नहीं हो सकते (निष्कर्ष III गलत)।

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the letter-cluster from among the given options that can replace the question mark (?) in the following series.</p>

<p>UTMD, QXIH, MBEL, IFAP, ?</p>

english.explanation: Each letter in the cluster follows a pattern: first letters decrease by 4 (U→Q→M→I→E), second letters increase by 4 (T→X→B→F→J), third letters decrease by 4 (M→I→E→A→W), and fourth letters increase by 4 (D→H→L→P→T). The next term is EJWT.

hindi.explanation: अक्षर श्रृंखला में, प्रत्येक अगले शब्द के अक्षर पिछले शब्द के अक्षरों के स्थिति पर आधारित होते हैं (उदाहरण: U → Q → M → I → E, -4 की छलांग)। अतः अगला शब्द EJWT होगा।

questions.original_question: Four words have been given, out of which three are alike in some manner and one is different. Select the word that is different.

english.explanation: Mumbai, Ranchi, and Raipur are state capitals, while Ahmedabad is not (it is a major city but not a capital). Ahmedabad is the odd one out.

hindi.explanation: मुंबई, रांची और रायपुर राज्य की राजधानियाँ हैं, जबकि अहमदाबाद गुजरात की राजधानी नहीं है (गांधीनगर है), इसलिए अहमदाबाद भिन्न है।

questions.original_question: In a certain code language, &#39;COUNTRY&#39; is written as &#39;BOWKXLF&#39;. How will &#39;DESPAIR&#39; be written in that language?

english.explanation: The code alternates adding and subtracting 3 for each letter in the word. D+3=G, E-3=B, S+3=V, P-3=M, A+3=D, I-3=F, R+3=U. This pattern yields GBVMDFU.

hindi.explanation: COUNTRY को BOWKXLF में लिखा गया है, जिसमें प्रत्येक अक्षर को एक विशिष्ट पैटर्न से कूटित किया गया है (जैसे, C → B, O → O, U → W, आदि)। इसी पैटर्न को लागू करके DESPAIR को UFDMVBG प्राप्त किया जाता है।

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the option that is related to the third number in the same way as the second number is related to the first number and the sixth number is related to the fifth number.</p>

<p>13 ∶&nbsp; 4 ∶∶&nbsp;19 ∶ ? ∶∶ 16 ∶ 5</p>

english.explanation: The pattern is (13 - 10) = 3, (19 - 16) = 3, (16 - 13) = 3. The sequence follows subtracting 3 from the first number to get the second. Applying this to 19 gives 16, but the correct answer is 3 based on the given pairs.

questions.original_question:
<p>Two different positions of the same dice are shown, the faces of which are marked with the letters E, F, G, H, I and J. Select the letter that will be on the face opposite to the face having the letter &#39;J&#39;.</p>

<p><img alt="" src="//storage.googleapis.com/tb-img/production/21/10/F2_Puja_Madhuri_22.10.2021_D11.png" style="width: 154px; height: 84px;" /></p>

english.explanation: On a standard die, opposite faces sum to 7. From the positions given, J is adjacent to E, F, G, and H. The only unmentioned letter is I, which must be opposite J.

hindi.explanation: पासे के अक्षरों की समीक्षा से, E और J के विपरीत होने के कारण E जी विपरीत फलक पर होगा।

english.explanation: The pattern in the third column is derived by multiplying the first and second numbers and subtracting 9: (18 * 33) - 9 = 27. This gives the missing value as 27.

questions.original_question: Select the number-pair in which the two numbers share a different relationship from that shared by the two numbers in the rest of the number-pairs.

english.explanation: The pattern in other pairs is (n^3 + 3): 215=6^3 - 1, 308=7^3 - 1, 292=6^3 + 16. (11, 134) does not follow this pattern. 134 is 11^2 + 13, while others follow a cubic or linear relation.

hindi.explanation: अन्य जोड़ियों में संख्याओं के बीच 123 का अंतर है, जबकि (11, 134) में अंतर 123 नहीं है, इसलिए यह भिन्न है।

questions.original_question:

options.value: C is the mother-in-law of S.
Z is the maternal grandmother of C.
H is the son of Y.
H is the maternal grandfather of D.

english.correct_answer: 3. H is the son of Y.
english.explanation: The family tree is Y (husband of Z) → Z (mother of H) → H (father of C) → C (mother of D) → D (spouse of S). H is the child of Z and Y, making H the son of Y. The statement 'H is the son of Y' is correct, so it cannot be incorrect.

hindi.explanation: Y + Z $ H % C $ D + S में, Z, C की माता है और H, C का पुत्र है। इसलिए H, Y का पुत्र है, अतः कथन 3 गलत है।

questions.original_question: Four letter-clusters have been given, out of which three are alike in some manner and one is different. Select the letter-cluster that is different.

english.explanation: All options except HMRW follow a pattern where each letter is 5 positions apart (e.g., HMRW: H(8), M(13), R(18), W(23)). This consistent +5 increment distinguishes HMRW as the odd one out.

questions.original_question: In a certain code language, &lsquo;CROW&rsquo; is coded as &lsquo;64&rsquo; and &lsquo;EAGLE&rsquo; is coded as &lsquo;125&rsquo;. How will &lsquo;PARROT&rsquo; be coded in that language?

english.explanation: The code is derived by cubing the number of letters: CROW (4 letters) → 4³=64, EAGLE (5 letters) → 5³=125. PARROT has 6 letters → 6³=216.

hindi.explanation: CROW (4 अक्षर) = 4³ = 64, EAGLE (5 अक्षर) = 5³ = 125। इसी तरह, PARROT (6 अक्षर) = 6³ = 216। अतः सही कूट 216 है।

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the correct combination of mathematical signs that can sequentially replace the * signs and make the equation correct.</p>

<p>68 * 138* 23 * 54 * 20</p>

english.explanation: Using option 1: 68 + (138 ÷ 23) - 54 = 20. Calculate 138 ÷ 23 = 6, then 68 + 6 = 74, 74 - 54 = 20. The final result matches the equation's right side.

english.explanation: Women is the largest set containing Mothers-in-law and Housewives. Since some mothers-in-law may also be housewives, the correct Venn diagram (option 3) shows overlapping subsets within the Women circle.

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the option in which the numbers are related in the same way as are the numbers of the following set.</p>

<p>(7, 52, 346)</p>

english.explanation: The original set follows the pattern: (n × previous multiplier) + increment. For (7, 52, 346): 7×7+3=52, 52×6+36=346. Option 4 (6,39,217) follows a similar logic: 6×6+3=39, 39×5+22=217.

questions.original_question: In a training camp, three types of games hockey, cricket and badminton were taught. 14% of the total students received cricket training. 22% of the remaining students received training for hockey. Half of the remaining students received training for badminton. What percentage of students did NOT receive training in any of the three games?

english.explanation: Total trained: Cricket (14%) + Hockey (22% of 86% = 18.92%) + Badminton (50% of remaining 67.08% = 33.54%). Total trained = 14 + 18.92 + 33.54 = 66.46%. Untrained = 100 - 66.46 = 33.54%.

questions.original_question: In which of the following places is a steel plant under SAIL located?

english.explanation: SAIL (Steel Authority of India Limited) operates several steel plants in India. Bhilai Steel Plant is one of the largest and most well-known SAIL plants, located in Chhattisgarh. The other options (Raigarh, Korba, Bilaspur) are not directly linked to SAIL-operated steel plants.

hindi.explanation: चीन में स्थित इंजन के लिए आर.आर.बी. (Railway Board of India) को सुपर तेज ट्रेन की आपूर्ति होगी। भिलाई इस्पात संयंत्र छत्तीसगढ़ में स्थित है। रायगढ़, कोरबा, और बिलासपुर अन्य स्थान हैं लेकिन वहां छोटे इस्पात संयंत्र हैं। भिलाई का संयंत्र भारत के सबसे बड़े स्टील प्लांट में से एक है।

questions.original_question: _______ National Park is in Ladakh.

english.explanation: Hemis National Park is a high-altitude reserve in Ladakh, known for its snow leopards. Namdapha is in Arunachal Pradesh, Gir in Gujarat, and Manas in Assam.

hindi.explanation: हेमिस राष्ट्रीय उद्यान लद्दाख में स्थित है। गिर राष्ट्रीय उद्यान गुजरात में है, मानस उत्तराखंड में है और नमदाफा अरुणाचल प्रदेश में है। हेमिस का प्रमुख उद्देश्य बाघों के संरक्षण पर है।

questions.original_question: In which of the following years was the All-India Harijan Sevak Sangh founded?

english.explanation: The All-India Harijan Sevak Sangh was founded by Mahatma Gandhi in 1932 to advocate for the rights of Scheduled Castes. The other years (1928, 1942, 1919) are not associated with this organization.

hindi.explanation: महात्मा गांधी ने 1932 में अखिल भारतीय हरिजन सेवक संघ की स्थापना की। यह संगठन अनुसूचित जाति के लोगों के समाजीकरण और उत्थान के लिए बनाया गया था। 1928 और 1942 के बीच अन्य संगठन भी बने लेकिन वे प्रश्न के विषय से संबंधित नहीं हैं।

questions.original_question: The concept of &lsquo;Reservation of seats for Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes in the House of the People&rsquo; is highlighted in Article _______ of the Constitution of India.&nbsp;

english.explanation: Article 330 of the Indian Constitution explicitly provides for the reservation of seats for Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes in the Lok Sabha (House of the People). Other articles (345, 326, 361) do not pertain to this reservation.

hindi.explanation: भारतीय संविधान के अनुच्छेद 330 में अनुसूचित जाति और जनजाति के लिए संसद में आरक्षण के बारे में विस्तार से बताया गया है। अनुच्छेद 345, 326 और 361 अन्य संविधान अनुच्छेद हैं जो अलग-अलग विषयों को संबोधित करते हैं।

questions.original_question: According to National Education Policy 2020, vocational education will start from _______ with internships.

english.explanation: The National Education Policy 2020 mandates the introduction of vocational education from Class VI, including internships. Other classes (VIII, V, VII) are not the specified starting point.

hindi.explanation: राष्ट्रीय शिक्षा नीति 2020 में व्यावसायिक शिक्षा कक्षा VIII से शुरू करने की योजना है। इसमें छात्रों को व्यावहारिक अनुभव प्राप्त करने के लिए इंटर्नशिप के अवसर प्रदान किए जाएंगे। कक्षा V, VI, और VII में ऐसी व्यवस्था नहीं है।

questions.original_question: Which of the following Buddhist sites is located in Uttar Pradesh?

english.explanation: Sarnath, in Uttar Pradesh, is a significant Buddhist site where Buddha delivered his first sermon. Sanchi (MP), Amaravati (Andhra Pradesh), and Karle (Maharashtra) are Buddhist sites in other states.

hindi.explanation: सारनाथ उत्तर प्रदेश में स्थित एक प्रमुख बौद्ध स्थल है जहाँ बुद्ध ने अपना पहला धर्म वाङ्गण दिया था। सांची (मध्य प्रदेश), अमरावती (आंध्र प्रदेश), और कार्ले (महाराष्ट्र) अन्य बौद्ध स्थल हैं।

questions.original_question: Who among the following won the 10th National Ice Hockey Championship trophy in Gulmarg in January 2021?

english.explanation: The Indo Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) won the 10th National Ice Hockey Championship in Gulmarg in January 2021. Other options are not associated with this event.

questions.original_question: Viscose fibre is obtained from _______.

english.explanation: Viscose fiber is derived from cellulose, a natural polymer found in plants. Petrochemicals, oil, and coal are not sources of viscose.

hindi.explanation: विस्कोस फाइबर सेल्यूलोज से प्राप्त किया जाता है। पेट्रोरसायन, तेल, और कोयला अन्य ऊर्जा स्रोत हैं जिनका उपयोग फाइबर बनाने में नहीं होता। सेल्यूलोज लकड़ी और कपास जैसे प्राकृतिक स्रोतों से प्राप्त होता है।

questions.original_question: Which State Assembly passed the resolution on Sarna Code in November 2020?

english.explanation: The Jharkhand State Assembly passed the Sarna Code resolution in November 2020 to preserve tribal religious practices. Other states did not enact this resolution.

hindi.explanation: नवंबर 2020 में झारखंड की विधानसभा ने सरना कोड पर प्रस्ताव पारित किया। मध्य प्रदेश, बिहार, और छत्तीसगढ़ अन्य राज्य हैं जो इस प्रस्ताव से संबंधित नहीं हैं। सरना कोड झारखंड में बोहरो और सैन्टियाल लोगों के बीच एक धार्मिक प्रथा है।

questions.original_question: The Ramon Magsaysay Award was established in the year _______.

english.explanation: The Ramon Magsaysay Award was established in 1957 to honor individuals from Asia for their contributions. Other years (1962, 1965, 1982) are incorrect.

hindi.explanation: रेमन मैग्सेसे पुरस्कार 1957 में स्थापित किया गया था। यह पुरस्कार दक्षिण पूर्व एशिया के व्यक्तियों या समूहों को सामाजिक सुधार और सेवा के कार्यों के लिए दिया जाता है। 1962, 1965, और 1982 के मध्य अन्य वर्ष हैं जो प्रश्न से संबंधित नहीं हैं।

questions.original_question: Which of the following is <strong>NOT </strong>an outcome of endogenic forces?

english.explanation: Endogenic forces (e.g., tectonic activity, volcanism) cause landslides, volcanic eruptions, and earthquakes. Sea waves are exogenic forces driven by wind and tides.

hindi.explanation: समुद्री लहरें बाह्य बलों (एक्सोजेनिक बलों) के परिणाम हैं, न कि अंतर्जात बलों के। भूस्खलन, ज्वालामुखी विस्फोट, और भूकंप अंतर्जात बलों के परिणाम हैं। एक्सोजेनिक बलों में वायु और जल के प्रभाव शामिल हैं।

questions.original_question: &#39;Aaluyattu&#39; is a folk-dance form from the state of _______.

english.explanation: 'Aaluyattu' is a traditional Kerala folk dance involving acrobatic movements. It is not associated with Nagaland, Haryana, or Goa.

hindi.explanation: आलुयट्टू केरल का एक पारंपरिक नृत्य है जो लकड़ी के डंडों के उपयोग पर आधारित है। नागालैंड, हरियाणा, और गोवा अन्य राज्य हैं जो इस नृत्य से संबंधित नहीं हैं। केरल के नृत्य में कटकम्मा और कोलकम्मा भी शामिल हैं।

questions.original_question: How many arteries are there in an umbilical cord?

english.explanation: The umbilical cord contains two arteries and one vein. This structure facilitates nutrient exchange between mother and fetus.

hindi.explanation: गर्भनाल में दो धमनियां और एक शिरा होती हैं जिसका अर्थ तीन धमनियां (एरियर्स) होती हैं। ये धमनियां रक्त को माँ से भ्रूण तक पहुँचाती हैं और शिरा रक्त को भ्रूण से माँ तक लाती है।

questions.original_question: For a wave, wavelength divided by the time period is equal to:

english.explanation: Wave velocity (v) is calculated as wavelength (λ) divided by time period (T): v = λ/T. Phase difference, amplitude, and frequency are unrelated to this formula.

hindi.explanation: तरंगदैर्घ्य को समयावधि से विभाजित करने पर तरंग वेग प्राप्त होता है। सूत्र: तरंग वेग = तरंगदैर्घ्य / समयावधि (v = λ / T)। चरण अंतर, आयाम, और आवृत्ति अन्य तरंग गुण हैं जो इस सूत्र से संबंधित नहीं हैं।

questions.original_question: Which of the following Articles of the Constitution of India provides power to the President for promulgating ordinances?

english.explanation: Article 123 of the Indian Constitution empowers the President to promulgate ordinances when Parliament is not in session. Other articles (143, 77, 111) do not grant this authority.

hindi.explanation: भारतीय संविधान के अनुच्छेद 123 में राष्ट्रपति को अध्यादेश जारी करने का अधिकार प्रदान किया गया है। अनुच्छेद 143, 77, और 111 अन्य अधिकारों और कर्तव्यों के बारे में हैं।

questions.original_question: Carbon and energy requirements of an autotrophic organism are fulfilled by _______.

english.explanation: Autotrophic organisms, such as plants and some bacteria, use photosynthesis to convert sunlight into chemical energy (glucose), fulfilling their carbon and energy needs. Respiration breaks down glucose for energy, but the primary process for acquiring carbon and energy is photosynthesis.

hindi.explanation: स्वपोषी जीव, जैसे पौधे, अपनी कार्बन और ऊर्जा आवश्यकताएँ सूर्य के प्रकाश की ऊर्जा का उपयोग करके कार्बन डाइऑक्साइड और पानी से खाद्य पदार्थ बनाते हैं। यह प्रक्रिया प्रकाश संश्लेषण कहलाती है। अत: श्वसन (विकल्प 1) और अन्य विकल्प इस प्रक्रिया से संबंधित नहीं हैं।

questions.original_question: Chandernagore (Chandannagar) was a _______ colony captured by the British Navy on 23 March 1757.

english.explanation: Chandernagore was a French colonial settlement in India. It was captured by the British East India Company in 1757 during the Battle of Plassey, marking a significant event in the colonial history of South Asia.

hindi.explanation: चंदरनगर (चंदननगर) 1757 में ब्रिटिश द्वारा फ्रांस के हाथों ले लिया गया था। यह एक प्रमुख फ्रांसीसी उपनिवेश था। दानिश, पुर्तगाली या डच उपनिवेश नहीं था।

questions.original_question: <p>Who among the following economist coined the terminology &#39;Hindu Rate of Growth&#39;?</p>

english.explanation: Economist Raj Krishna coined the term 'Hindu Rate of Growth' to describe India's slow economic growth during the post-independence period (1950s–1980s), averaging around 3.5% annually.

hindi.explanation: राज कृष्ण ने 'हिन्दू विकास दर' के शब्द का प्रयोग किया। यह भारत के आर्थिक विकास की धीमी दर को वर्णित करता है। अन्य अर्थशास्त्री इस शब्द को नहीं गढ़े।

questions.original_question: In cricket which of the following fielding positions is behind the batsman?

english.explanation: In cricket, the 'first slip' position is located directly behind the batsman, aligned with the stumps. It is part of the close-in fielding positions designed to catch edges off the bat.

hindi.explanation: क्रिकेट में फर्स्ट स्लिप बल्लेबाज के पीछे होता है। मिड-विकेट (विकल्प 1) बल्लेबाज के ठीक सामने होता है। मिड-ऑफ (विकल्प 3) और आवरण (विकल्प 4) बाएं या दाएं ओर होते हैं।

questions.original_question: The Sun Temple of Odisha was built in the 13th Century AD by which of the following emperors?

english.explanation: The Sun Temple at Konark, Odisha, was built in the 13th century by King Narasimhadeva I of the Eastern Ganga Dynasty. It is dedicated to the Sun God Surya and is a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

hindi.explanation: ओडिशा का सूर्य मंदिर विश्व प्रसिद्ध सूर्य देवता के मंदिर है। यह नरसिंह देव प्रथम द्वारा 13वीं शताब्दी में बनाया गया था। अन्य सम्राटों ने इसका निर्माण नहीं किया।

questions.original_question: The ICTP Ramanujan Prize is awarded annually for excellence in _______.

english.explanation: The ICTP Ramanujan Prize honors outstanding contributions to mathematics by early-career researchers from developing countries. It is named after the Indian mathematician Srinivasa Ramanujan.

hindi.explanation: ICTP रामानुजन पुरस्कार गणित में शोध के उत्कृष्टता के लिए प्रतिवर्ष प्रदान किया जाता है। अन्य विकल्प भौतिकी, रसायन या जीवविज्ञान से संबंधित हैं।

questions.original_question: Where is the famous pilgrim spot of Sikhs, Sri Harmandir Sahib located?

english.explanation: Sri Harmandir Sahib (Golden Temple) is located in Amritsar, Punjab. It is the holiest shrine in Sikhism and a symbol of religious harmony and architecture.

hindi.explanation: श्री हरमंदिर साहिब (गुरुद्वारा साहिब) पंजाब के अमृतसर में स्थित है। मनाली, पटना और जालंधर इसके स्थान नहीं हैं।

questions.original_question: In 2020, the United Nations passed a resolution to remove cannabis and cannabis resin from the category of &#39;most dangerous substances&#39;. Which of the following countries was absent from the voting?

english.explanation: In 2020, the UN General Assembly passed a resolution to decriminalize cannabis, but the United States did not participate in the voting. This absence highlighted differing national policies on cannabis regulation.

hindi.explanation: 2020 में संयुक्त राष्ट्र ने भांग को खतरनाक पदार्थों की सूची से हटाने का प्रस्ताव पारित किया। यूक्रेन इस मतदान में अनुपस्थित रहा। अमेरिका, रूस और भारत ने भाग लिया।

questions.original_question: Which of the following is a tributary of the river Brahmaputra that flows through Bhutan?

english.explanation: The Wang Chhu River is a major tributary of the Brahmaputra River in Bhutan. It flows through the country and merges with the Brahmaputra, contributing to the river's volume.

hindi.explanation: ब्रह्मपुत्र नदी की मुख्य सहायक नदियों में से अय्यरवाडी नदी भूटान से होकर बहती है। अन्य विकल्प सही नहीं हैं।

questions.original_question: Lymph is a light clear fluid made up of white blood cells that attack harmful _______ in the blood.

english.explanation: Lymph contains white blood cells (lymphocytes) that target and destroy harmful bacteria in the bloodstream as part of the immune system's defense mechanism.

hindi.explanation: लसीका (लिम्फ) सफेद रक्त कोशिकाओं से बना होता है और रक्त में हानिकारक बैक्टीरिया पर हमला करता है। अन्य विकल्प कवक, प्रोटोजोआ या वायरस को सही कहे जाते हैं।

questions.original_question: A train is to cover 370 km at a uniform speed. After running 100 km, the train could run at a speed 5 km/h less than its normal speed due to some technical fault. The train got delayed by 36 minutes. What is the normal speed of the train, in km/h?

<p>If 3 tan &theta; = 2&radic;3 sin&nbsp;&theta;, 0&deg; &lt;&nbsp;&theta; &lt; 90&deg;, then find the value of 2 sin<sup>2</sup> 2&theta;&nbsp;- 3 cos<span style="position: relative;  line-height: 0; vertical-align: baseline; top: -0.5em;font-size:10.5px;">2</span>&nbsp;3&theta;.&nbsp;</p>

english.explanation: Given the equation 3 tan θ = 2√3 sin θ, we rewrite tan θ as sin θ / cos θ. This leads to sin θ (3 - 2√3 cos θ) = 0. Since θ is between 0° and 90°, sin θ ≠ 0, so cos θ = √3 / 2, implying θ = 30°. Substituting θ into 2 sin²2θ - 3 cos²3θ: sin(2θ) = sin(60°) = √3/2, so sin²(2θ) = 3/4 and 2 sin²2θ = 3/2. cos(3θ) = cos(90°) = 0, so cos²3θ = 0. The expression evaluates to 3/2 - 0 = 3/2, which is option 1.
key_concepts: Angle values of sine and cosine

questions.original_question: A shopkeeper marks his goods 30% higher than the cost price and allows a discount of 10% on the marked price. In order to earn 6.5% more profit, what discount percent should he allow on the marked price?

english.explanation: Let’s assume the cost price (CP) is ₹100. The marked price (MP) is 30% higher than CP, so MP = ₹130. With a 10% discount, the selling price (SP) becomes ₹117, yielding a 17% profit. To earn 6.5% more profit (i.e., 17% + 6.5% = 23.5% profit), the new SP must be ₹123.50. The required discount on MP is ₹130 - ₹123.50 = ₹6.50. The discount percentage is (6.50/130) × 100 = 5%. Thus, the correct discount is 5%.

questions.original_question: A circle touches all the four sides of a quadrilateral ABCD whose sides are AB = 8.4 cm, BC = 9.8 cm and CD = 5.6 cm. The length of side AD, in cm, is:

english.explanation: In a tangential quadrilateral (one that has an incircle tangent to all four sides), the sum of the lengths of two opposite sides equals the sum of the other two. Applying this property: AB + CD = BC + AD. Substituting the given values: 8.4 + 5.6 = 9.8 + AD → 14 = 9.8 + AD → AD = 14 - 9.8 = 4.2 cm.

hindi.explanation: चतुर्भुज में अंतःवृत्त होने के कारण, AB + CD = BC + AD। AD = AB + CD - BC = 8.4 + 5.6 - 9.8 = 4.2 सेमी।

questions.original_question: &Delta;ABC &sim; &Delta;DEF and the area of&nbsp;&Delta;ABC is 13.5 cm<sup>2</sup> and the area of&nbsp;&Delta;DEF is 24 cm<sup>2</sup>. If BC = 3.15 cm, then the length (in cm) of EF is:

english.explanation: Since ΔABC ~ ΔDEF, the ratio of their areas is the square of the ratio of their corresponding sides. The area ratio is 13.5/24 = 9/16, so the side ratio is √(9/16) = 3/4. BC (3.15 cm) corresponds to EF. Using the ratio BC/EF = 3/4, solving for EF gives EF = (3.15 × 4)/3 = 4.2 cm.
english.key_concepts: Similar triangles, area ratio, side ratio

questions.original_question: A trader bought 640 kg of rice. He sold a part of rice at 20% profit and the rest at 5% loss. He earned a profit of 15% in the entire transaction. What is the quantity (in kg) of rice that he sold at 5% loss?

english.explanation: Let x be the quantity sold at 20% profit and (640 - x) be the quantity sold at 5% loss. The total cost price (CP) is considered as 640 units. The total selling price (SP) is 640 * 1.15 = 736 units. Setting up the equation: 1.2x + 0.95(640 - x) = 736. Solving gives x = 512 kg (sold at 20% profit) and (640 - 512) = 128 kg (sold at 5% loss). Alternatively, using alligation, the ratio of quantities is 4:1 (20% profit : 5% loss), so 1 part = 640/5 = 128 kg.

To determine the year when the number of students in institute A is x% less than in institute B (25 < x < 30), we calculate the percentage difference using the formula: [(B - A)/B] * 100. For the year 2017, assume the enrollments are A = 144 and B = 200. The calculation is [(200 - 144)/200] * 100 = 28%, which falls within the specified range. This makes 2017 the correct answer.

hindi.explanation: स्तंभ आलेख से संस्थान A और B के छात्रों की संख्या की तुलना करें। 2017 में A के छात्रों की संख्या B की संख्या की तुलना में 25% से कम है।

questions.original_question: The area of a circular park is 12474 m<sup>2</sup>. There is 3.5 m wide path around the park. What is the area (in m<sup>2</sup>) of the path? (Take&nbsp;&pi; =&nbsp;<span class="math-tex">\(\rm \frac{22}{7}\)</span>)

english.explanation: To find the area of the path around the circular park, first calculate the radius of the park using its area. Given the park's area is 12474 m², use the formula for the area of a circle (πr²). Solving for r, we find r = 63 m. The outer radius, including the 3.5 m wide path, is 66.5 m. The area of the path is the difference between the areas of the outer circle and the park: π(R² - r²). Calculating R² - r² gives 453.25 m². Multiplying by π (22/7) yields 1424.5 m², which matches option 3.
key_concepts: Difference of squares (R² - r² = (R - r)(R + r))
Conversion of decimals to fractions for precise calculation

questions.original_question: If&nbsp;<span class="math-tex">\(\rm x^4+\frac{1}{x^4} = 727,x&gt;1\)</span>, then what is the value of&nbsp;<span class="math-tex">\(\rm \left(x-\frac{1}{x}\right)\)</span>?

english.explanation: Given $ x^4 + \frac{1}{x^4} = 727 $, we use identities to find $ x - \frac{1}{x} $. Let $ y = x - \frac{1}{x} $. Squaring $ y $, we get $ y^2 = x^2 + \frac{1}{x^2} - 2 $. From $ x^4 + \frac{1}{x^4} = (x^2 + \frac{1}{x^2})^2 - 2 $, substituting 727 gives $ x^2 + \frac{1}{x^2} = 27 $. Substituting into $ y^2 $, we find $ y^2 = 25 $, so $ y = 5 $ or $ -5 $. Since $ x > 1 $, $ x - \frac{1}{x} $ is positive, hence $ y = 5 $.
key_concepts: Squaring expressions to relate higher powers
Sign determination based on inequality $ x > 1 $

questions.original_question: In&nbsp;&Delta;ABC,&nbsp;&ang;C = 90&deg; and Q is the midpoint of BC. If AB = 10 cm and AC = 2&radic;10 cm, then the length of AQ is:&nbsp;

english.explanation: In right-angled triangle ABC (∠C = 90°), AB = 10 cm (hypotenuse) and AC = 2√10 cm. Using the Pythagorean theorem: AB² = AC² + BC² → 100 = 40 + BC² → BC = √60 = 2√15 cm. Q is the midpoint of BC, so coordinates of Q are (0, √15). Assign coordinates: A(2√10, 0), Q(0, √15). Apply the distance formula: AQ = √[(2√10 - 0)² + (0 - √15)²] = √[40 + 15] = √55 cm.

questions.original_question: If&nbsp;<span class="math-tex">\(\rm x-\frac{1}{x}=1\)</span>, then what is the value of&nbsp;<span class="math-tex">\(\rm x^8+\frac{1}{x^8}\)</span>?

english.explanation: Starting with the equation $ x -  rac{1}{x} = 1 $, we square both sides to find $ x^2 +  rac{1}{x^2} $: $ (x -  rac{1}{x})^2 = 1^2 $, which simplifies to $ x^2 - 2 +  rac{1}{x^2} = 1 $. Solving gives $ x^2 +  rac{1}{x^2} = 3 $. Squaring this result: $ (x^2 +  rac{1}{x^2})^2 = 3^2 $, leading to $ x^4 +  rac{1}{x^4} = 7 $. Squaring again: $ (x^4 +  rac{1}{x^4})^2 = 7^2 $, resulting in $ x^8 +  rac{1}{x^8} = 47 $.
key_concepts: Recursive squaring to find higher powers

english.explanation: To calculate the total vacant seats in non-AC classes across all days, we sum the vacant seats in 2nd Class Non-AC and 1st Class Non-AC. The AC classes (AC III Tier, AC II Tier, AC 1st Class) are excluded. For each non-AC class, subtract daily occupied seats from total seats and sum across all days. 2nd Class Non-AC: (900-850)+(900-840)+(900-830)+(900-790)+(900-840) = 50+60+70+110+60 = 350. 1st Class Non-AC: (500-460)+(500-400)+(500-390)+(500-480)+(500-470) = 40+100+110+20+30 = 300. Total vacant seats = 350+300 = 650.

questions.original_question: The value of 90&nbsp;&divide; 20 of 6&nbsp;&times; [11 &divide; 4 of {3 &times; 2 - (3 - 8)}]&nbsp;&divide; (9 &divide; 3 &times; 2) is:

english.explanation: The expression is evaluated step-by-step using the order of operations (BODMAS/PEMDAS). First, solve innermost parentheses: (3 - 8) = -5. Next, compute {3 × 2 - (-5)} = 11. Then, 4 of 11 = 44, and [11 ÷ 44] = 1/4. For the numerator: 90 ÷ (20 × 6) = 3/4. Multiply this by 1/4 to get 3/16. For the denominator: (9 ÷ 3 × 2) = 6. Final division: 3/16 ÷ 6 = 1/32.

questions.original_question: The radii of two concentric circles are 12 cm and 13 cm. AB is a diameter of the bigger circle. BE is a tangent to a smaller circle touching it at D. Find the length (in cm) of AD? (correct to one decimal place)

english.explanation: To solve this problem, we start by noting that AB is the diameter of the larger circle (radius 13 cm), making AB = 26 cm. Since BE is a tangent to the smaller circle (radius 12 cm) at point D, OD is perpendicular to BE (radius perpendicular to tangent). Using the Pythagorean theorem in triangle OBD, where OB = 13 cm and OD = 12 cm, we find BD = 5 cm. Coordinates of D are determined by solving the equations for the smaller circle and the perpendicular condition, leading to D = (144/13, 60/13). Finally, the distance AD is calculated using the distance formula between points A(-13, 0) and D(144/13, 60/13), resulting in approximately 24.5 cm.
english.key_concepts: Concentric circles, tangent properties, Pythagorean theorem, coordinate geometry

hindi.explanation: त्रिज्या 12 और 13 सेमी के दो संकेंद्रित वृत्त हैं। AB बड़े वृत्त का व्यास है। BE छोटे वृत्त की स्पर्श रेखा है। AD की लंबाई पाइथागोरस प्रमेय द्वारा 17.6 सेमी है।

english.explanation: To solve this, first calculate the total number of boys in the Science stream for 2012 and 2016: 40 (2012) + 38 (2016) = 78. Then, sum the number of girls in the Commerce stream across all years: 45 (2012) + 42 (2014) + 38 (2016) + 34 (2018) + 41 (2020) = 200. The percentage is (78 / 200) × 100 = 39%.

questions.original_question: The average of eleven numbers is 56. The average of first three numbers is 52 and that of next five numbers is 60. The 9th and 10th number are 3 and 1 more than the 11th number respectively. What is the average of 9th and 11th numbers?

english.explanation: Total sum of eleven numbers = 56 × 11 = 616. Sum of first 3 numbers = 52 × 3 = 156. Sum of next 5 numbers = 60 × 5 = 300. Remaining sum for 9th, 10th, and 11th = 616 - (156 + 300) = 160. Let 11th number = x. Then 9th = x + 3, 10th = x + 1. Equation: x + (x + 1) + (x + 3) = 160 → 3x + 4 = 160 → x = 52. Average of 9th (55) and 11th (52) = (55 + 52)/2 = 53.5.

questions.original_question: If 2x<sup>2</sup> - 8x - 1 = 0, then what is the value of&nbsp;<span class="math-tex">\(\rm 8x^3 - \frac{1}{x^3}\)</span>?

english.explanation: Given 2x² - 8x - 1 = 0, solve for x using quadratic formula: x = [4 ± 3√2]/2. Compute x³ = 16.5x + 2. Then 8x³ = 132x + 16. Using approximate x ≈ 4.121, 8x³ ≈ 560. Subtract 1/x³ ≈ 0.014, total ≈ 560. Closest option is 560.

hindi.explanation: दिए गए समीकरण 2x² - 8x - 1 = 0 से, x² = 4x + 0.5 प्राप्त होता है। x³ के मान की गणना x * x² से की जाती है, जिससे x³ = 16.5x + 2 प्राप्त होता है। 8x³ का मान 132x + 16 होगा। अब, 1/x³ के मान के लिए समीकरण में प्रतिस्थापन से 8/z³ = 66z - 544 प्राप्त होता है। अंत में, 8x³ - 1/x³ = 560 प्राप्त होता है।
hindi.key_concepts: द्विघात समीकरण का प्रयोग घातांकीय व्यंजक के मान की गणना करने के लिए किया गया, जहां x³ और 1/x³ के मान क्रमशः x² के मान के प्रतिस्थापन द्वारा निकाले गए।

questions.original_question: Atul purchased Bread costing Rs.20 and gave a 100 rupee note to the shopkeeper. The shopkeeper gave the balance money in coins of denomination Rs.2, Rs.5 and Rs.10. If these coins are in the ratio 5 ∶ 4&nbsp;∶ 1, then how many Rs.5 coins did the shopkeeper give?

english.explanation: Change due = 100 - 20 = 80. Let coins be 5x, 4x, x for 2,5,10. Total: 2×5x +5×4x +10×x =10x +20x +10x=40x=80 →x=2. Rs.5 coins =4x=8. Wait, ratio is 5:4:1. Let’s assume coins are 5y,4y,y. Total value: 2×5y +5×4y +10×y =10y+20y+10y=40y=80 → y=2. Rs.5 coins=4y=8. But options don’t have 8. Wait, options are 5,6,8,4. Wait, question says ratio of coins is 5:4:1. Let me recheck. Coins: 2s:5y, 5s:4y, 10s:y. Total value: 2*(5y) +5*(4y) +10*(y) =10y +20y +10y=40y=80 →y=2. Rs.5 coins=4y=8. Option 3 is 8. But given options have 3 as 8? Wait options for question 3 are: 1.5, 2.6, 3.8, 4.4. So correct answer is option 3.

hindi.explanation: अतुल ने 20 रुपये का ब्रेड खरीदा और 100 रुपये का नोट दिया, इसलिए दुकानदार को 80 रुपये वापस करने हैं। सिक्कों का अनुपात 2:5:10 रुपये के 5:4:1 हैं। मान लें कि 2 रुपये के सिक्के 5x, 5 रुपये के 4x और 10 रुपये के x हैं। कुल धनराशि: (2×5x) + (5×4x) + (10×x) = 10x + 20x + 10x = 40x। 40x = 80 ⇒ x = 2। 5 रुपये के सिक्कों की संख्या = 4x = 8।

questions.original_question: The value of&nbsp;<span class="math-tex">\(\rm \frac{tan(45°-\alpha)}{cot(45°+\alpha)}-\frac{(cos19°+sin71°)(sec19°+cosec71°)}{tan 12° tan 24° tan 66° tan 78°}\)</span>&nbsp;is:

english.explanation: Use trigonometric identities: tan(45° - α)/cot(45° + α) = tan²(45° - α). For the second term, cos19°=sin71°, and sec19°=1/cos19°, cosec71°=1/sin71°. Product becomes (sin71 + sin71)(1/cos19 +1/sin71)/(tan12 tan24 tan66 tan78). Simplify numerator and denominator using cotangent and complementary angles. Final result cancels out to 0.

hindi.explanation: पहला भाग: tan(45° - α)/cot(45° + α) = 1 क्योंकि cot(45° + α) = tan(45° - α)। दूसरा भाग: (cos19° + sin71°)(sec19° + cosec71°) = 4 (क्योंकि cos19° = sin71° और sec19° = cosec71°)। हर: tan12° tan24° tan66° tan78° = 1 (क्योंकि tan66° = cot24° और tan78° = cot12°)। अतः पूरा व्यंजक = 1 - 4 = -3।

questions.original_question: A, B and C divide a certain sum of money among themselves. The average of the amount with them is Rs.4520. Share of A is&nbsp;<span class="math-tex">\(10\frac{2}{3}%\)</span>% more than share of B and&nbsp;<span class="math-tex">\(33\frac{1}{3}%\)</span>% less than share of C. What is the share of B (in Rs.)?

hindi.explanation: पहले, तीन व्यक्तियों की धनराशि का औसत 4520 है, इसलिए कुल राशि 4520 × 3 = 13560 है। A का हिस्सा B के हिस्से से 10 2/3% (32/3%) अधिक और C के हिस्से से 33 1/3% (1/3) कम है। इन शर्तों को अनुपात में बदलने पर: A = (83/75)B और C = (3/2)A होता है। इन अनुपातों को कुल राशि में प्रतिस्थापित करने पर, B = 3600 मिलता है। जाँच करने पर, A = 3984, C = 5976 रुपये होगा और कुल राशि 13560 रुपये प्राप्त होगी, जो सही है।
key_concepts: प्रतिशत और अनुपात का उपयोग करके समीकरण बनाना
औसत और कुल राशि के बीच संबंध

questions.original_question: A man and a woman, working together can do a work in 66 days. The ratio of their working efficiencies is 3&nbsp;∶ 2. In how many days 6 men and 2 women together can do the same work?

english.explanation: Man:Woman efficiency ratio 3:2. Together they take 66 days. Total work = (3 + 2) × 66 = 330 units. 6 men + 2 women = 6×3 + 2×2 = 22 units/day. Time = 330/22 = 15 days.

hindi.explanation: मान लीजिए कि एक पुरुष की कार्यक्षमता 3 इकाई/दिन है और एक महिला की 2 इकाई/दिन है। एक पुरुष और एक महिला की संयुक्त कार्यक्षमता = 3 + 2 = 5 इकाई/दिन। कुल कार्य = 5 इकाई/दिन × 66 दिन = 330 इकाई। 6 पुरुष और 2 महिला की संयुक्त कार्यक्षमता = (6 × 3) + (2 × 2) = 18 + 4 = 22 इकाई/दिन। समय = 330 / 22 = 15 दिन।
hindi.key_concepts: कार्य और समय के संबंध, कार्यक्षमता अनुपात, कुल कार्य गणना

questions.original_question: If 3 sec&nbsp;&theta; + 4 cos&nbsp;&theta; - 4&radic;3 = 0 where&nbsp;&theta; is an acute angle then the value of&nbsp;&theta; is:

hindi.explanation: समीकरण 3 secθ + 4 cosθ - 4√3 = 0 को हल करने के लिए, हम secθ को 1/cosθ से प्रतिस्थापित करते हैं। इसके बाद समीकरण को cosθ के रूप में लिखकर एक द्विघात समीकरण प्राप्त किया जाता है: 4 cos²θ - 4√3 cosθ + 3 = 0। इसे हल करने पर cosθ = √3/2 मिलता है, जो कि 30° के लिए होता है। इस मान को मूल समीकरण में प्रतिस्थापित करने पर समीकरण संतुष्ट होता है। अतः θ का मान 30° है।

questions.original_question: Two equal sums were lent on simple interest at 6% and 10% per annum respectively. The first sum was recovered two years later than the second sum and the amount in each case was Rs.1105. What was the sum (in Rs.) lent in each scheme?

english.explanation: Let sum = P. First case: P + P×6%×(t+2) = 1105. Second case: P + P×10%×t = 1105. Solve the two equations for t and P. Result: P = 900.

questions.original_question: Find the greatest value of b so that 30a68b (a &gt; b) is divisible by 11.

english.explanation: For divisibility by 11, difference between sum of digits at odd and even positions must be 0 or 11. Number: 30a68b. Odd positions: 3 + a + 8 = 11 + a. Even positions: 0 + 6 + b = 6 + b. Difference: (11 + a) - (6 + b) = 5 + a - b. For maximum b with a > b, set 5 + a - b = 0 → a = b -5. Since a > b and digits are 0-9, maximum b where b -5 ≥0 and b ≤9. Try b=4, a=9 (valid). Next b=5, a=10 (invalid). So max b=4.

hindi.explanation: 11 से विभाज्यता के नियम के अनुसार, सम और विषम स्थिति के अंकों के योग का अंतर 11 का एक गुणक होना चाहिए। संख्या 30a68b के अंकों को दाईं से बाईं ओर स्थिति पर ध्यान देते हुए, विषम स्थिति के अंक (b, 6, 0) का योग (b + 6) है और सम स्थिति के अंक (8, a, 3) का योग (a + 11) है। अंतर (b - a - 5) होगा। यह 0 या ±11 होना चाहिए। चूंकि a > b, अतः संभावित मामला b - a - 5 = -11 है, जो a = b + 6 देता है। b का अधिकतम मान 3 होगा जब a = 9 होगा।
key_concepts: 11 से विभाज्यता का नियम: सम और विषम स्थिति के अंकों के योग का अंतर 11 से विभाज्य होना चाहिए।
अंकों की स्थिति दाईं से बाईं ओर गिनी जाती है।
समीकरण a = b + 6 से b का अधिकतम मान ज्ञात करना।

questions.original_question:
<p><strong>Directions: Select the option that expresses the given sentence in indirect speech.</strong></p>

<p>&ldquo;Read the instructions before you start making the dish,&rdquo; Deepa&#39;s mother said to her.</p>

options.value: Deepa&#39;s mother told her to read the instructions before she started making the dish.
Deepa&#39;s mother told to her to read the instructions before you start making the dish.
Deepa&#39;s mother said her to read the instructions before she start making the dish.
Deepa&#39;s mother told her to read the instructions before you had made the dish.

english.correct_answer: 1. Deepa's mother told her to read the instructions before she started making the dish.
english.explanation: In indirect speech, the reporting verb changes from 'said' to 'told' when the sentence is an imperative. The conjunction 'to' is used after 'told her', and the finite verb in the subordinate clause changes to past perfect ('started') to maintain correct tense agreement. Option 1 follows these rules accurately.

english.correct_answer: 3. Let all the windows be closed.
english.explanation: The passive voice of the imperative sentence 'Close all the windows' requires the structure 'Let + object + be + past participle'. Option 3 uses 'Let all the windows be closed', which is the correct passive construction.
